app.indexer Module

Indexer Service for Processing PDF Documents and Managing Embeddings.

This service is responsible for:

  • Processing PDF documents stored in Google Cloud Storage (GCS).

  • Converting the text content of PDFs into vector embeddings using Vertex AI.

  • Storing the document embeddings in a PostgreSQL database with the pgvector extension.

  • Providing health check endpoints to monitor service status and connections.

  • Allowing feedback to be recorded and analyzed.

Key Components:

  • FastAPI: Web framework for building APIs.

  • Google Cloud Storage (GCS): Stores PDF documents.

  • Cloud SQL (PostgreSQL) with pgvector: Stores document embeddings.

  • Vertex AI: Provides embeddings and LLM capabilities.

  • Asynchronous Operations: Utilizes asyncio for non-blocking I/O operations.

  • Configuration: Uses environment variables for customizable settings.

Environment Variables (Required):

  • DB_INSTANCE_NAME: Cloud SQL instance connection name.

  • DB_NAME: Database name.

  • DB_PASS: Database password.

  • DB_USER: Database username.

  • PDF_BUCKET_NAME: GCS bucket name for PDF storage.

Environment Variables (Optional):

  • CHUNK_OVERLAP: Overlap between text chunks for embedding (default: 50).

  • CHUNK_SIZE: Size of each text chunk for embedding (default: 2000).

  • EMBEDDING_BATCH_SIZE: Number of embeddings to process in a single batch (default: 10).

  • MAX_CHUNKS: Maximum number of chunks to process in a single batch (default: 50).

  • MAX_FILE_SIZE: Maximum file size in bytes for PDF processing (default: 100MB).

class app.indexer.DatabaseManager

Bases: object

Manages database operations and connections.

async add_embeddings(texts: List[str], metadatas: List[dict], batch_size: int = 10) → int

Adds embeddings to the database in batches. :param texts: List of text content to be embedded. :type texts: List[str] :param metadatas: List of metadata dictionaries for each text. :type metadatas: List[dict] :param batch_size: Size of each batch for processing embeddings (default: EMBEDDING_BATCH_SIZE). :type batch_size: int

Returns:

The total number of embeddings added to the database.

Return type:

int

async check_document_is_indexed(source: str) → bool

Checks if a document (by source) is already fully indexed by looking for the is_embedded metadata flag.

Parameters:

source – The source of the document

async close()

Closes the database connection.

async connect()

Establishes an asynchronous connection to the PostgreSQL database.

async ensure_connection()

Ensures the database connection is alive. Reconnects if necessary.

Returns:

True if the connection is healthy, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

async get_document_count() → int

Retrieves the count of documents in the document_embeddings table. :returns: Count of documents in the table. :rtype: int

async get_feedback_analytics() → List[Dict[str, Any]]

Retrieves analytics about feedback patterns. :returns: List of dictionaries containing feedback analytics. :rtype: List[Dict[str, Any]]

async initialize()

Initializes the database schema, including creating the pgvector extension and the necessary tables for document embeddings and message feedback.

async record_feedback(message_id: int, feedback_value: str, source_context: dict | None = None, metadata: dict | None = None)

Records message feedback in the database. :param message_id: ID of the message for which feedback is recorded. :type message_id: int :param feedback_value: Value of the feedback (e.g., “positive”, “negative”). :type feedback_value: str :param source_context: Optional context of the message source (e.g. metadata). :type source_context: Optional[dict] :param metadata: Optional additional metadata for the feedback. :type metadata: Optional[dict]

async app.indexer.process_pdf(blob_name: str) → int

Processes a single PDF file from GCS bucket into vector embeddings. :param blob_name: The name of the blob to process :type blob_name: str

Returns:
